content.rendered:
The Office of Adventist Mission assists the church in keeping focused on its Core Mission of making Disciples of all People Groups through:

  1. Initiating congregations of believers among new geographic areas and people groups also termed as Unreached or Least Reached People Groups, and
  2. Reporting and Informing church entities and members of mission progress and opportunities among unreached people groups while inspiring the channelling of all spiritual gifts, tithes and offerings to the realization of the Church’s Mission.

We achieve this through our efforts in:

Global Mission Pioneer Projects

Men and Women dedicate their lives to initiate a congregation of believers in a new geographic area or unreached people groups in a period of 3 to 5 years and thus expand the presence of the Seventh-day Adventist Church throughout the world. (gm.adventistmission.org).

Global Mission Study Centres

These Centres provide resources and training for anyone who wishes to share the love of Jesus to people from the world religions. (www.globalmissioncenters.org)

Life Hope Centres

Community Felt Needs Projects that gives an opportunity for the church to follow Christ’s Method in sharing hope and leading people of specific people groups to Jesus (www.urbancenters.org)

Mission Stories

Read, watch, share through different media platforms and download inspiring stories of how Seventh-day Adventists partner with God in making disciples around the world. Understand how your Mission Offerings have contributed for the realization of the Church’s Mission around the globe. (Watch Mission Stories)

Mission Offerings

Through Mission Offerings, members and all individuals have an opportunity of sharing God’s love throughout the world and participate in the fulfilment of Christ’s Commission to preach the Gospel to every Nation (Matthew 28:18-20). Click here to see how you can participate in the Great Commission through your Generosity. and its should take us to https://am.adventistmission.org/mission-offering
